summary: This is an email chain from June 25, 2020, discussing plans for victim notification in the Epstein case. It outlines a two-tiered approach: phone calls to a small group of statutory victims represented by counsel, and written notifications to a larger group of Epstein victims. The correspondence involves prosecutors and victim services personnel coordinating the process.

persons.name: Ori
persons.context: Mentioned in the forwarding note as the original message sender; appears to be involved in scheduling the victim notification call.

events.title: Victim Notification Planning Call
events.description: A scheduled call to discuss and coordinate victim notification procedures for the Epstein case indictment, involving AUSAs and victim services staff.

keyFacts: The document reveals a planned two-tiered victim notification strategy: phone calls to a small group of statutory victims represented by counsel, and written notifications only to a larger group of Epstein victims.
The notification process was being coordinated in advance to ensure all parties were aligned, indicating careful procedural planning by the prosecution.
The email notes that the vast majority of victims are represented by counsel, either in the criminal case or civil litigation, which influenced the notification approach.
Multiple names and email signatures (like EFTA00147923, EFTA00147924) appear to be redacted or placeholder identifiers, suggesting the document contains non-public personnel information.
